examples.x: Five, four, three, two, one, zero… We have lift-off.

senses.definition: a temperature, pressure, etc. that is equal to zero on a scale

examples.x: It was ten degrees below zero last night (= −10°C).
The thermometer had fallen to zero.

senses.definition: the lowest possible amount or level; nothing at all

examples.x: I rated my chances as zero.

senses.definition: an area or a region with a particular feature or use

examples.x: a pedestrian zone (= where vehicles may not go)
They have called for a 100-mile buffer zone (= protected area) around the island to protect the seals.

senses.definition: one of the areas that a larger area is divided into for the purpose of organization

examples.x: postal charges to countries in zone 2

senses.definition: an area or a part of an object, especially one that is different from everything that is around it

examples.x: When the needle enters the red zone the engine is too hot.
the erogenous zones of the body

senses.definition: one of the parts that the earth’s surface is divided into by imaginary lines that are parallel to the equator
in a state in which you feel confident and are performing at your best

examples.x: When I'm in the zone, writing is the most satisfying thing in the world.

senses.definition: a state in which things are strange, mysterious or secret; a state that exists on the dividing line between two things

examples.x: the twilight world of the occult
The dissidents lived in a twilight world of hushed voices and secret meetings.
the twilight zone between living and merely existing
They lived in the twilight zone on the fringes of society.
